oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Oklahoma Roundup - 1947-04-21 - KOMA - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part two of a performance from the Oklahoma Roundup radio program on April 21, 1947 on radio station KOMA (Oklahoma City, Okla). Staff includes Hiram Higsby (master of ceremonies, writer), Allan Page (announcer, director), and Kenyon Brown (producer).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ann Bond; Chuck Davis; Jack Beasley; Lem Hawkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (0:00) Allan Page announces the show credits / (0:24) [Unidentified] performs "[Unidentified song]" / (1:55) Hiram Higsby and Ann Bond tell a joke / (2:48) Ann Bond performs "Pins and Needles In My Heart" / (5:40) Hiram Higsby introduces the next song / (5:56) Chuck Davis performs "I Tipped My Hat (And Slowly Rode Away)" / (8:40) Hiram Higsby tells a joke / (8:50) Jack Beasley and Ann Bond perform "Many Tears Ago" / (11:14) Lem Hawkins and Hiram Higsby tell a joke / (11:40) Lem Hawkins performs "It Makes No Difference Now" / (13:32) [Unidentified] announces show credits / (13:37) [Unidentified] advertisement [incomplete]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Oklahoma Roundup; KOMA (Radio station : Oklahoma City, Okla.); CBS Inc.; Bond, Ann; Davis, Chuck; Beasley, Jack; Higsby, Hiram, 1909-1975;
